FuncDef:
The nat load-balance hash-fields command configures a hash factor for ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network.
The undo nat load-balance hash-fields ip l4 command restores the default configuration.
By default, the source and destination IP addresses are used as the hash factor for ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network.
CLIs: nat load-balance hash-fields ip { l3 | l4 }
undo nat load-balance hash-fields ip l4

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates a hash factor based on the source and destination IP addresses.
-

Indicates a hash factor based on the source and destination IP addresses and the source and destination port numbers.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a hash factor for ECMP and trunk load balancing on a CGN network, run the nat load-balance hash-fields command. If the default hash factor can ensure even load balancing, specify l3 (default value). Otherwise, specify l4 to implement more even load balancing.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
